means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 沃思住所名称，来源于古英语，含义是“圈用地，居留地”(enclosure,settlement)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"价值"之意。
means: worth与value近义，但前者强调事物本身的价值。
value ： 侧重指使用价值，着重人、物或事所具有的重要性、用途或优秀品质等。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些词均可表"值得的"之意。
means: worth ： 前置词，后接名词或相当于名词的词，指做某事有一定价值或意义。
worthy ： 形容词，与worth同义，但搭配不相同。
worthwhile ： 形容词，用作表语或定语，指某事物是值得的，或某事是值得做的。

sentence.Network_en: It is certainly worth checking up on your benefit entitlements.
sentence.Network_cn: 查清楚你可以享受哪些福利是绝对有必要的。

sentence.Network_en: By the time he's twenty he'll know everyone worth knowing in Washington.
sentence.Network_cn: 到20岁时，他就会认识华盛顿所有值得认识的人。

sentence.Network_en: Any coach worth his salt would do exactly as I did.
sentence.Network_cn: 任何称职的教练都会采取和我一模一样的行动。

phrase.cizu_name: for all someone is worth informal 非正式

jx.jx_en_mean: as energetically or enthusiastically as someone can

lj.lj_ly: he thumps the drums for all he's worth.

jx.jx_en_mean: so as to obtain everything one can from someone

lj.lj_ly: the youths milked him for all he was worth and then disappeared.
lj.lj_ls: 年轻人榨干了他的所有，然后消失了。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to present a comment, suggestion, or opinion without making a claim as to its importance or validity

lj.lj_ly: for what it's worth, she's very highly thought of abroad.
lj.lj_ls: 不论真假，海外都很看重她。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)sufficiently good, enjoyable, or successful to repay any effort, trouble, or expense
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)值得的；值得麻烦的；值得花钱的

lj.lj_ly: it requires a bit of patience to learn, but it's well worth it.
lj.lj_ls: 学习需要一点耐心，但完全值得付出。

lj.lj_ly: it requires a bit of patience to learn, but it's well worth it.
lj.lj_ls: 学习需要一点耐心，但完全值得付出。

lj.lj_ly: it requires a bit of patience to learn, but it's well worth it.
lj.lj_ls: 学习需要一点耐心，但完全值得付出。

jx.jx_en_mean: To the utmost of one's powers or ability.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 尽全力：至某人力量或能力的极限

jx.jx_en_mean: Even though it may not be important or valuable
jx.jx_cn_mean: 不论好坏：即使可能不重要或价值不大

lj.lj_ly: Here's my advice, for what it's worth.
lj.lj_ls: 这是我的建议，尽管可能用处不大，你姑且听听

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English w(e)orth (adjective and noun), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch waard and German wert

encyclopedia.content: WORTH ( 沃思 ) WORTH 源自于英文单词，worth英音：[wə:θ]美音：[wɝθ] 中文可读作沃思，译为价值。 词典解释 形容词a. [F] 1. 有(...的)价值，值。.. This necklace is worth 1,000 US dollars. 这条项链值一千美元。 2. 值得(做。..) That novel is not worth reading. 那部小说不值得一读。 The exhibition is worth a visit. 这展览值得一看。 3. 拥有。..价值的财产的 名词n. [U] 1. 价值 This research

entry.def: If something is worth a particular amount of money, it can be sold for that amount or is considered to have that value.

example.ex: These books might be worth £80 or £
example.tran: 90 or more to a collector... 这些书对收藏家而言可能值八九十英镑或更多。

example.ex: His mother inherited a farm worth 15,000 dollars a year...
example.tran: 他母亲继承了一处年产值为1.5万美元的农场。

entry.def: Worth combines with amounts of money, so that when you talk about a particular amount of money's worth of something, you mean the quantity of it that you can buy for that amount of money.

example.ex: I went and bought about six dollars' worth of potato chips...
example.tran: 我去买了大约6美元的薯条。

example.ex: Large numbers of deer now roam the forests and are causing thousands of millions of roubles-worth of damage.
example.tran: 现在大批鹿群在森林里游荡，造成价值几十亿卢布的损失。

entry.def: Worth combines with time expressions, so you can use worth when you are saying how long an amount of something will last. For example, a week's worth of food is the amount of food that will last you for a week.

example.ex: You've got three years' worth of research money to do what you want with...
example.tran: 你有可维持3年的研究经费去做自己想做的事。

example.ex: After an hour and a quarter's-worth of cleansing, toning and pampering, the difference to the way my skin felt was remarkable.
example.tran: 经过1小时15分钟的清洁、柔肤和精心护理后，我的皮肤摸上去感觉大不一样。

entry.def: If you say that something is worth having, you mean that it is pleasant or useful, and therefore a good thing to have.

example.ex: He's decided to get a look at the house and see if it might be worth buying...
example.tran: 他决定去瞧瞧那座房子，看是否值得买下。

example.ex: If this was what his job required, then the job wasn't really worth having...
example.tran: 如果这是他的工作所需，那么这份工作真的不值得去做。

entry.tran: 具有(某一行动)的价值;值得(做)
entry.def: If something is worth a particular action, or if an action is worth doing, it is considered to be important enough for that action.

example.ex: No one is worth a great deal of sacrifice...
example.tran: 没有谁值得付出重大的牺牲。

example.ex: I am spending a lot of money and time on this boat, but it is worth it...
example.tran: 我在这艘船上花了很多金钱和时间，但都很值得。

entry.def: Someone's worth is the value, usefulness, or importance that they are considered to have.

example.ex: He had never had a woman of her worth as a friend...
example.tran: 他从来没有过像她这样值得交往的女性朋友。

example.ex: The team would have need of a driver of his worth.
example.tran: 这支队伍需要一位他这样技术水平的司机。

entry.tran: 拼命地; 全力以赴地；热情高涨地
entry.def: If you do something for all you are worth, you do it with a lot of energy and enthusiasm.

example.ex: We both began waving to the crowd for all we were worth...
example.tran: 我们俩开始使劲地朝人群挥手。

example.ex: Push for all you're worth!
example.tran: 使足劲推！

entry.tran: 尽可能地利用;充分利用
entry.def: If someone does something for all it is worth, they do it as much as possible and for as long as they can get benefit from it.

example.ex: You get anywhere with legal aid only by playing the system for all it is worth.
example.tran: 你若想让法律援助多少发挥点作用，只有充分利用这一制度。

example.ex: ...taking an idea and exploiting it for all it's worth.
example.tran: 选取一种观点并对其充分加以挖掘

entry.tran: (尤为避免显得傲慢)不管好坏，不管有没有用
entry.def: If you add for what it's worth to something that you say, you are suggesting that what you are saying or referring to may not be very valuable or helpful, especially because you do not want to appear arrogant.

example.ex: For what it's worth, my feeling is that ice in whisky is fine...
example.tran: 不管怎么样，我觉得威士忌放冰很好。

example.ex: I've brought my notes, for what it's worth.
example.tran: 不管有没有用，我反正把我的笔记带来了。

entry.tran: (行为或活动)值得…去做，对…有好处
entry.def: If an action or activity is worth someone's while, it will be helpful, useful, or enjoyable for them if they do it, even though it requires some effort.

example.ex: It might be worth your while to go to court and ask for the agreement to be changed...
example.tran: 上法庭要求对协议进行改动也许对你有益。

example.ex: You'll find it well worth your while to learn something of each island's special features before visiting them.
example.tran: 你会发现游览之前先了解一下各岛的特色非常有帮助。

means.word_mean: 1. an indefinite quantity of something having a specified value;
2. the quality that renders something desirable or valuable or useful

list.explanation: 没价值的，没用的，没意义的

example.en: This pen is not worth a damn.

list.explanation: 没价值的，没什么用处的，不起什么作用的

example.en: His word isn't worth a plugged nickel.
Mary isn't worth a plugged nickel at baseball.
example.zh: 玛丽在棒球方面是无用武之地的。

auth_sentence.content: It is worth pausing to absorb what that means.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is worth pausing to absorb what that means.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is worth pausing to absorb what that means.

auth_sentence.content: But we believe it's a price worth paying.
auth_sentence.res_content: But we believe it's a price worth paying.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But we believe it's a price worth paying.

auth_sentence.content: It ruins people's sense of self-worth, dignity.
auth_sentence.res_content: It ruins people's sense of self-worth, dignity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It ruins people's sense of self-worth, dignity.

stems_affixes.word_buile: worth值得→adj.值得…的 n.价值 v.值…的，价值… prep.值得……的
worth值得+less无……的→adj.无价值的, 无益的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 值得做的, 值得出力的
stems_affixes.word_buile: worth值得+while→adj.值得做的, 值得出力的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有价值的, 应……的, 可敬的, 值得的, 相称的
stems_affixes.word_buile: worth值得+y表形容词→adj.有价值的, 应……的, 可敬的, 值得的, 相称的
wor=worth值得+ship状态→认为值得[信任]→尊敬

Sentence.sentence: Before the internet, renting a surfboard, a power tool or a parking space from someone else was feasible, but was usually more trouble than it was worth
Rachel Botsman, the author of a book on the subject, says the consumer peer-to-peer rental market alone is worth $ 26 billion
Even if they know what the company is up to, they still have no idea what they're paying for Face book because people don't really know what their personal data is worth.
It is a society well worth studying,and its efforts to conquer the gender gap impart a vital lesson—though not the lesson the Swedes had in mind。
One problem is that time becomes more valuable and time becomes more worth money.
And we are worth 20, 000 pounds, right?

means.word_mean: (表示比率)值(多少钱), 值得;有…价值；值…钱

sentences.en: The picture is worth at least twenty pounds.
sentences.cn: 这张图片至少值二十英镑。

jushi.english: He is well worth sorrow that buys it with his silver.
jushi.chinese: 花钱买苦吃的,理应吃到苦头。

jushi.english: Her promise isn't worth a penny.
